# GitHub Actions Status Badges

Add these badges to your README.md to show build and test status:

## Build Status
```markdown
![CI/CD Pipeline](https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/YOUR_REPO/actions/workflows/ci-cd.yml/badge.svg)
```

## Test Coverage
```markdown
[![codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/YOUR_USERNAME/YOUR_REPO/branch/main/graph/badge.svg)](https://codecov.io/gh/YOUR_USERNAME/YOUR_REPO)
```

## Combined Badge Example
```markdown
[![CI/CD Pipeline](https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/YOUR_REPO/actions/workflows/ci-cd.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/YOUR_REPO/actions/workflows/ci-cd.yml)
[![Tests](https://img.shields.io/badge/tests-154%20passed-success)](https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/YOUR_REPO)
[![Coverage](https://img.shields.io/badge/coverage-70%25%2B-brightgreen)](https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/YOUR_REPO)
```

## How to Use

1. Replace `YOUR_USERNAME` with your GitHub username
2. Replace `YOUR_REPO` with your repository name
3. Add the badges to the top of your README.md

Example:
```markdown
# English Learning Portal

![CI/CD Pipeline](https://github.com/johndoe/english-portal/actions/workflows/ci-cd.yml/badge.svg)
[![Tests](https://img.shields.io/badge/tests-154%20passed-success)](https://github.com/johndoe/english-portal)
[![Coverage](https://img.shields.io/badge/coverage-70%25%2B-brightgreen)](https://github.com/johndoe/english-portal)
```
